content:
Yes, I agree that it is desirable to have a small kernel.
After exploring some approaches, my preliminary conclusion is that as far as I can tell, it is currently impossible to construct an efficient coinductive datatype (Edit: without unsafe) even if it is done by hand without developing a general interface for coinductive type definition, at least if we allow arbitrary universe levels for σ in corec above (which I believe is possible if we don't care about efficiency).

So I agree that one probably needs unsafe to realize this, except if somebody has a great idea how we can efficiently transform an instance of SF' with high-universe σ into an efficient instance with low-universe σ (which is possible if we don't require efficiency!).
Paul A. Reichert has marked this topic as resolved.
